comment:
Something that occurred to me as I‚Äôve watched all of this unfold was the jewelry JD wears, specifically his rings; if he physically assaulted her to the extent that she claims, wouldn‚Äôt there be some evidence of that on his rings in one form or another? Blood in particular, as skin cells or touch/trace DNA does not prove anything. Even if he had them cleaned thoroughly, especially multiple times, bleach is very corrosive and damaging to silver & particularly gold, so there would likely be evidence of that too. Cleaned or not cleaned, I would imagine if he truly assaulted her as violently & frequently as she claims, there would likely still be trace blood evidence in the nooks and crannies of those rings. 

I dunno, food for thought I suppose. She provided elaborate, detailed accounts of his ‚Äòviolence‚Äô. If I had his resources, I‚Äôd have hired a forensic team to check for her blood everywhere & anywhere she alleged where all of this had taken place. 

It‚Äôs such a shame that the most obvious of details do not appear to be enough to instill serious doubt in both the courts of law & ‚Äòpublic opinion‚Äô. Aside from the fact that abusive people always have some history of it in some form or another, the behavior of AH‚Äôs parents alone speaks volumes. Although at some point there were text messages that came to light about AH texting her mother about JD being violent towards her & not wanting to tell her father (before or after their divorce, I can‚Äôt remember). You‚Äôd think that the parents of an alleged victim in fear for their life due to a man‚Äôs ‚Äònever ending violence‚Äô would be infuriated, upset, confrontational, etc. and *not* pleading with him to forgive _her_ because it was the lawyers‚Äô idea to create such allegations in order to avoid eviction from his home. The same ‚Äòvictim‚Äô who is *so* afraid of her husband bringing different men into his penthouse at late hours while he is out of town. Even *if* the recorded conversations are out of context, there are still so many other telling details like AH‚Äôs history of physical assault with her ex wife on the record, including allegedly against her own sister (the same grown up ‚Äòbaby sister‚Äô she unnecessarily went on that tangent about so desperately & vehemently needing to protect from JD during the UK libel trial while avoiding a direct question), testimony from her former assistant, the ordeal with the $7 million dollar (lack of) donation, the video(s) AH released where she clearly is attempting to instigate a nasty fight caught on tape, and so on. 

I am frustrated just by following this case, so I can‚Äôt begin to fathom how JD feels. The man is no saint, and I do not doubt for a moment that he has made some poor decisions in the heat of the moment fighting with AH, but not for a moment do these allegations scream chronically, violently abusive husband...

comment:
What I see is the exact opposite. Johnny Depp has a much bigger, giant fanbase. Of course, he would twist the story and get away with this in the end, even if it took a couple years... What I see is a woman under an enormous amount of pressure, trying to figure out a way to disassociate with this mess.
About that one phone call recording, I believe it only exposes a small part of the truth... Maybe they had a sadomasochistic relationship and she came to the point that she understood that's not she wanted anymore. And Johnny is using their previous SM experiences against her.  That phone call can be about it too.
I mean... I have been in an abusive relationship and trust me, there are times you get fed up being the victim and you lash back.
I am not a fan of Amber Heard, I only saw her in Aquaman and I was fine with her acting. But to me, all this hate towards her feels obnoxious to me. Maybe Johnny bought her lawyer too, who knows? It is all about how you prefer to perceive things... She may be a diva (that's what I gathered from other people's comments) but being a diva and being a predator are totally different things. Despite how much I used to love Johnny Depp, I wouldn't vouch for him or anyone, even my relatives or friends. Because we may never know what kind of monsters are lurking among us under disguise. I'd rather avoid taking sides in this kind of situation. Even "proven" guilty, it may be a twisted version of the reality...
Just like how it was with my ex. Nobody, none of his friends would believe me when I told them what he has been doing to me because he was all sweet and cutesy around other people, he was showing his true face when we were alone.

comment: Johnny is pretty shy, he has a sense of humor but mentioned he had a stutter when he was little. A stutter ALONE can dismiss any hesitancy with his answers, and the smile is simply because he turns to humor to make uncomfortable and dark things seem a bit less serious. This combination of things is one of the reasons why he got so many "odd" roles. If you have ever seen him with his children, you see how gentle he is with them. Obviously I don't him personally, but from these clips and the things I do know about him, it is absolutely REVOLTING that one of the rare good men in this world was abused by this borderline sociopathic woman who almost took everything away from him, everything he had worked so hard for. This whole ordeal just shows his patience and reluctance to get angry with his ex and all the accusers who abandoned him just because it was easier to think that he abused Amber than the other way around.

comment:
This was hard to watch, because I think they're both responsible. I think he probably did hit her - in fact he admitted to doing so in one of the recordings he released. I think they both assaulted each other, because there are some people that set you off in ways that nobody in your life ever has and when you've had your first physical altercation with heavy drinking involved, that becomes the first of many. Each one after becomes worse, and both become more physically involved.
What bothers me is that you were harder to watch than either one of them. You have no idea what happened, yet you're depicting one as the sole victim and one as the sole abuser. Much of your analysis was based on ridiculous circumstances, like when he was looking up to her, and she back at him - well yeah - she was standing behind him and slightly to the side, and he's shorter than she is.  It's not that deep. Amber isn't innocent, she's abusive and toxic - but in this specific relationship - so was he. They are toxic together.
What you don't seem to understand is that one is a better higher quality actor, and one just isn't. I promise you - it's not Amber Heard.

comment: It's crazy watching videos of Johnny and Amber because it's like watching me and my child's mother's life 8 years ago.. Seeing Johnny trying to hide the pain behind a half smile and his eyes are lost looking for something to make sense to what all is happening and Amber being able to just completely willing to destroy his life with lies if it meant she got what she wanted and not even have a drop of remorse is too real for me. I'm glad he had made such an impact on so many lives to give him the support to find truth. It's almost been 10 years for me since I had everything taken away and was pinned as a violent monster. No one listened, no one cared, and now almost half of my life is gone and I'm still lost and confused about why and how she could have done this and I still am in love with her as if we were still 20 and she's on to the 5th man and last time we talked she told me she can't remember any of the 6 years together and she can't believe that I can remember every single day, every word she said to me, every smile, every laugh and all she can say is get over it. I don't even want to sleep anymore because when I wake up and realize that having my family back was just a dream again is too much.... I'm just rambling on now and need to stop but if anyone reads this, I don't know who you are but thanks for listening and I'm sorry if I had bothered you by having read this.

author: Jill

comment: She looks like she's trying too hard to make it seem like she's the victim. Mainly by the way she has all of these gestures and movements. Like she's twitchy because she's "traumatized". I can't say I know what happens to everyone who is abused, because I honestly don't. Different people show different body language. However, I do know one instance dealing with abuse. My cousins are abused by their "dad", and they react in different ways. Two of them are more shut off about it. They mumble when they talk about him, or don't talk at all. My other cousin, who has a more fiery temper, gets very passionate. She tends to get very angry, and rants about him. She also barley moves unless she's working as she talks. Amber is way too relaxed to be "abused". From what I've seen, people who deal with abuse are very tense. Some prefer to disappear from the conversation, while others try to control their emotions when being questioned. Amber's shoulders are kind of slouched, while she's making all these hand movements. She's making up a story, and she's moving to make it seem more legit. Like hoe she describes hitting, and raises her hand as she does. There's also her eyes. Even through the fuzziness of the camera, I can tell her eyes are dead. Normally abuse victims eyes are filled with repressed emotion. Not Amber. Her eyes are cold and almost defensive. She doesn't want to be caught. Like I said, I can't speak for every abuse case, but I have seen what it can do to some people. Heck, I myself have grown in a bad household, but that doesn't mean everyone is going to react the same. Please, if you are being abused tell a professional, or a trusted adult. Don't hold it it. It'll only make things worse. Thank you for reading, and have a good day/night.

comment:
The status of research in 2020: Body language is not at all a reliable tool for uncovering lies or deceit. The only way is to collect information that can be compared to other sources. Detecting lies through body language is a pseudo-science, and everyone is equally bad at it. 
Sources: 
B.M. DePaulo, J.l. Lindsay, B.E. Malone, L. Muhlenbruck, K. Charlton, og H. Cooper, ¬´Cues to decep-tion¬ª, Psychol. Bull. 129, 2003, s. 74‚Äì118.

comment:
Ok but this is annoying me so goddamn much
She accused Johnny of domestic abuse, yes?
They're there to discuss domestic abuse, yes?
They why the hell does her lawyer keep objecting TO questions about domestic abuse?
I mean, I only studied law for 4 years, but I'm pretty sure you can't say "this is irrelevant" to a relevant question
EDIT: Never have I ever heard not just the "victim" but her fucking lawyer complain about people... whispering? I- 
Also the way she narrowed her eyes and smiled condescendingly after pointing at the other side and saying "no, I was talking about them." seems like, evil to me. I don't know how to explain it. It's what you'd see from the narcisisstic school queen in a movie. Definitely not how a victim would act
EDIT: (again because her laywer - I'm guessing - is seriously boggling) If given a yes or no question, obviously if it is relevant to the matter, the person asked should answer yes or no. Not only is it logical and moral, but also it is important proof. Dodging the question will only play against you. They wanted a clear statement they could use, whether in your favour or not. What is he talking about, "answer the question however you would like" and her saying "thank you" in that appreciative way, as if he saved her life? Jesus fuck
OMG the judge saying "overruled" in such a bored annoyed voice gave me life lmaoo. And the woman out right laughing because this is just ridiculous.

comment:
My initial thought especially during the 2nd vid with amber answering Q & A 
Her eyes are slightly drooped, skin looked flushed (possibly due to lighting), above average eye movements, and the locking of the lips could be due to being under the influence of a psychoactive substance of some sort. Her reaction time is much slower as well. As a damn good liar/manipulator myself; not as much as in the past, and as a user of various substance as well as being on psych meds I feel as though this definitely could be plausible. Though w/o being present one would not know for certain. 
Social behaviors, linguistic terms, psyche, past criminal behavior, 1st person testimonies regarding her character; including past/current drug abuse and misuse including increased probability of the misuse and abuse of drugs due to such a stressful situation makes me conclude she's guilty. 
Plus if she was sober and smart, she should have anticipated any and all potential questions that are to be asked in such a case, therefore allowing you the time to rehearse and recite your answers in a manor one would do when preparing for a job interview....aka...utilizing mock interviews 
Idk just my take on it

comment: When I saw this video, I had flashbacks of my own life. I am a man and I experienced that nothing I said was believed. There are psychological reports about me that are as far from the truth as one can hardly imagine. I testified against the mother of our son and I was "crucified" for it. I didn't make up any of the bad things the mother did and out of shame I didn't tell everything from the beginning. It's been the toughest 10 years of my life and the story isn't over yet. At some point I even brought solid evidence. For this I had to make recordings. They had not been "officially" analyzed to this day (and they don`t will), but I have been charged with making such recordings and this "criminal" act has finally been included in the reports on me. I want and always wanted to protect my child from violent - especially emotional - abuse. I am reporting here because, on the one hand, I have experienced how a man is doing, whose ex-wife is believed every lie by official authorities, but everything I tell is interpreted as a lie. (And I have witnesses! ... but nobody asks them!) At the same time I have experienced that the psychological analysis of a survey is or can be completely irrational. When you are asked things over and over again, sometimes in front of your opponent in court, and you keep hearing his lies, about things that were sometimes years ago, about which you are ashamed to mention them, you are repeatedly confronted with disbelief and accusations and with interpretations of why you say something or the things you say are always put into perspective, etc. The result is that you no longer act rationally in such a survey, everything is emotionally overlaid in many layers. It's not like being asked directly about a situation, the matter is highly dynamic and complex. (I could scream out of a second just by thinking of it. This all got traumatic to me.) All of this creates exactly the symtomatics that one displays when one lies. I'm a real Johnny Depp fan and struggle to be neutral towards women these days, but I don't want to take sides with anyone here. Anything is possible. Sorry, but I don't think you can read anything in such a situation.

comment:
I listen to all this explanation and I just realized that I do some of this things and they don't mean what he said. Like I lay my head on my hand often and I'm definitely not bored then. It's just something I sometimes do and what's making me comfortable. I sometimes also smirk but it's just like a tick to a stressful situation that like... trims my bad thoughts and bad feelings and also sometimes keep me from crying in argue. That leads me to question how universal those readings of behavior really are and how often they don't mean what is thought they mean. ü§î
And this have nothing to do with the case itself but more with body reading at all. I watched some of those and I always hear some explanations of what I also do often and I'm always surprised that those can mean things that I don't even want or feel myself. ü§î

author: DickyDoodles

comment:
So about that smile. the moment I saw him smirking I connected his gesture to the gestures I always make. 

When I was younger my Russian language arts instructor would yell and embarrass me in class. I was an irresponsible student and Russian education is very strict so it was justifiable. anyways, I would smile in return. as if her yelling had no effect on me. it was a way of both making her look like she's crazy and holding back my tears. well, actually, I can't really explain why I uncontrollably smile when being verbally attacked by someone or when I'm in a ridiculous situation. Johnny was in a ridiculous situation. He would've thought that he was obviously the victim but the world seemed to think differently. it was hilarious. but not in a funny way.

I don't think anything I just said made sense but I can safely say that his smile was not something to hold against him. It could be that this smile is an INFP thing or just me and Johnny in particular. Can anyone else relate? I'm curious.

comment:
Sorry Observe, don't mean to jump your train, but I think I'm good at this too. Let's see. I'm pausing and giving my read before I hear yours: When she stalls in her speech, watch her eyes... she is looking for answers, "her" truth even over small stuff. It appears she's looking around the room. She is not. She is literally looking around her mind. A consummate liar can't stop and always fear triggering an avalanche of truths. In a liars mind, if I can't remember it, it's time to lie again.

When we move to her deposition, at around 5:30, she says no, head shakes yes. She does look around a lot. She is looking for several things, an escape, an excuse to end this, a lifeline of any sort, a friend, an out... and always her truth. The lick thing, is two-fold, she's being intentionally rude, F you, and arrogant, notice how pronounced it is. Combine it with the unblinking stare at the interviewer, and you know its target! First it's no to domestic violence, then it's yes. I defended myself. It bothers me I can't see her hands and legs. They are great tellers! First, don't look at what she's doing and saying once we hit "DOORMAT," look at what she's not doing!!! Absolutely no emotion, totally devoid of expression. We're exploring her claims of human misery and abuses, and she's nowhere in the room. She's gone. These are indicators: one, she's not even in the room, and there is no truth to her words. Reaching across to her shoulder is a blocking gesture, but it's also an attempt to solicit sympathy, by suggesting a past violence. How do I know this? She immediately looks to her attorney, why am I paying you!!! Help me! The eyebrows go up. Aren't you going to help? Damn I need to see those hands. Hands tell a LOT!!! The isn't it true, question: she stretches her lips in a suggested smile that never surfaces. It's there though. Head tilt is a challenging gesture, get this over with bitch! Easy. The eyes tell its meaning. The immediacy of the head snap to her attorney shows I was right. Finally, dumb ass, you're gonna help me now! Wrinkle forehead, face goes sad. She's about to say something intended to be disarming. Many times, no not many times, hmmm, what was my lie again, I forget!!! Observe and I def saw that the same! I read more but he could have too. Okay. He hit me for a very longtime before I ever um, I'm lost. First it's a lie. No doubt! How do I know. It makes no sense and it's already in conflict with her, I'm not a doormat sentiment. Move to strike, followed by listen to this, would you, is intended to make Amber reel, and is setting her up for a solid punch. Hit, "play." Observe asked why is she eating? She's eating to busy her mouth in case what she is about to hear is so damning she can gather up a lie. Observe, this is woman who already realizes she has lost. This is all damage control. You totally missed the ball on this section IMO. Lol, now you finally pick up on the emotionless relation. No need to pick up on the abuser thing. That's a given. We already know that. That's why we're here! Look at that penetrating stare at the ground. She may be passionless, but that, my friends, is shame and admission of guilt. She answered while eating. A question with no risk. Now, I want to see off to her left. I know her lawyer is there, but there is something she's finding a measure of comfort from too? What? Don't know, but it lifts her head. She's thinking, I got this. Lol, I um, I was trying to escape is what she is trying to do... funny admission, especially staccato and pronounced!!! Believe me! This is truth. LIE!!! As she continues with her account she drags, she pulling at lies cartwheeling through her head, that good say that, nope, yep say that, etc. Liar. Suddenly she is acting out the actions of the story with her HANDS: is this isn't true, how can I be demonstrating what happened. Please believe me once. PLEASE. Okay, isn't it true, head goes down immediately, I am not going to be believed F! She for that instant wants to cry. Disagree on the push and tested. Amber is on the verge of wanting to tell the truth here, she's tired of the lies. The right series of questions right there would bring it out. A truth came out, amazing. Then came the into the room gesture right back to the lies, that truth scared her. BOO. If you're "blocking" a door as stated, he can't push the door into her. He can try, but her proximity to it, means that can't work. Were Johnny Lou Ferigno maybe, but Amber in my opinion is stronger than Johnny physically and emotionally. She can't be broken, because she just doesn't care anymore. She is buried in lies. I am quitting at the 13 minute mark. She's too easy.

Anytime anyone, anyone, ever tells you "it's true," or words to that effect, 90% of the time it's a lie. Truth tellers never think to say that. Because they are telling the truth. That's why.

No worries Observe. I actually find this boring.

Okay. I have to step back in for a second, 20:07, alright, we started this story in a room by a couch, when security enters. But no, we're not in a room, doesn't fit my story, we end up on a stair's landing, but no, no (not dangerous enough yet) now Johnny magically appears somehow at the top of the stairs behind sister and is actually handling her threateningly. We were on top of the Empire State building, yeah, that's it!!! Now Amber too magically appears at stair top too, in a rage blackout supposedly, but the story still comes. She's blackout with rage but not so blacked out she can't assert with authority what was happening... hmmm? lmfao. Amber, please stop lying, would be what I would say.

Nope. Johnny now: his hemming and hawing is different. There's emotion, and shame. He doesn't want to be here either, but for an entirely different reason. He's embarrassed and doesn't want to say what he has to, he's so done with all this. Observe, you missed the base on Johnny's smile, because it's not a smile. It was only one side of his mouth. Do that. Does that feel like a smile? When would you do that? That's right. He's frustrated and exasperated, he's said this too many times already, and I'm about to say something again, but not because I want to, but because you're making me! Don't you own a pen? My truth isn't changing in other words, so write this shit down, please. On the red carpet, he looks like he's just had the crap beaten out of him. He's defeated. He lies about wanting to go out to the country with his girl (graciousness to the Japanese people), his body language is the truth, she's poison to him. Even looking her in the eye makes him sick to his stomach at this point.

It's like he's waiting for a fortuitous bus, and he really doesn't care which one of them gets hit.

She tries to look blas√© to try to convey that this is no-big-deal. The acting is forced, like a teenager who tries lying to their parents but doesn‚Äôt realize yet they see straight through her.
author: Kellie Larsen

comment:
Sorry but if you're supposed to be an expert, how is it difficult to see that she is trying to answer "yes I understand the question" (nodding) and then said "no" as the answer to the question. She's answering 2 questions at once, "Do you understand" and "did you commit domestic violence". She even tries to clarify. Why would you act like she's answering one question and just randomly nodding yes but saying no? People are really going to overlook that? It was very obvious she was nodding yes I understand and verbally saying no I did not.

I highly doubt she was casually snacking as you said, she looks uncomfortable and someone probably told her to use that tactic to buy time because she has a habit of blurting out things she thinks and feels. Maybe her lawyer told her to do it but it does not come across as carefree. Sorry but if you genuinely believe what you're saying and not just pandering to simpletons, you're not very insightful. 

I'm not even defending her, they both admitted in audio to abusing each other. But people's simplistic views of her body language are way off. She's not communicating boredom, she appears fatigued, uncomfortable and you don't even know if she's on medication etc. Being fed up and burned out does not equal boredom. Even if he was never abusive in any way and she was completely lying, someone's not going to feel BORED. They'll feel frustrated and overwhelmed which leads to fatigued body language. 

Whispering is completely distracting and anyome would feel attacked in this situation as you have people trying to invalidate and manipulate what you're saying. It's conflict between numerous people in the room, it's continuous arguing and normal for people to smile, roll their eyes and act completely fed up just as you would if you were arguing with a partner and feeling like it was going nowhere or like the other party has no interest in finding real truth or solution. 

I think plenty of what she says is true, but I think they were both abusive towards each other due to their own admissions. I'm not sure what Ambers case is exactly, but even if she did hit him at some stage, that doesn't necessarily mean she has no case as it could have been self defence or retaliation. But based on their own admissions, it seems neither of them were viewing throwing objects, smashing cupboards shut etc as violence, which it is violence in the home. There are a lot of semantics but it's quite clear they both were violent, as to who initiated things, we have no business commenting. 

The way you wear a suit and try to give a professional impression, state your views will be around 70% accurate, and that you can get a good view of the situation, then proceed to make whiny voices impersonating Amber, which is bullying... and you're doing this for attention without a care about how you are affecting people or perpetuating inaccurate views about victims... all for the sake of revenue and pumping your merch. Cutesy music at the end after you laughed and teased people in a case of domestic violence. I'd be ashamed of myself and view my revenue as dirty money quite frankly. Commenting on people's personal lives in such a childish and inappropriate way has just become standard entertainment for you and the sheep that buy into this type of sick entertainment. This type of content is nothing more than gossip with your own version of "somewhere between pseudoscience" thrown in. I'd be ashamed. I did one polite reaction video that was supportive of someone and even that made me feel like a sell out and I removed it. It's beyond me how anyone can feel comfortable making a living with this level of deterimental gossip. It's truly immoral. It's like paparazzi who buzz around people like flies trying to get a piece - truly disgusting.

comment: Any woman who has actually been "hit" or "beaten", remembers every single detail, not to mention, when being questioned, it is extremely distressing to even talk about it. It is humiliating, it is shameful and it is painful. When real abuse happens, it is in "slow motion"...you can see it, over and over....you dream it, every loud noise triggers that memory. You remember the temperature, the time, who was there, who protected you and who didn't, all the words that were said,  what you were wearing, what HE was wearing, the food you ate, the conversation before, the conversation after and definitely, the words that brought on the beating, and you know why you remember???? Because getting hit by a man, leaves bruises, not make up bruises....real swelling, black eyes from just a slap, swollen lips from just a swipe, bruises and broken bones from just being thrown across a room, never mind being "hit"....that can kill a woman and lots of times....one "hit" leaves you unconscious....not to mention....25 years later, you remember it like it was 2 minutes ago....Pullll-eeeeeze..... She is lying. No doubt.

comment: Lastly, Id like to mention that, making calculations and taking time before one answers an important question especially one in court its prudent behavior. You needn't the excuse or trickery of having your mouth full to take a pause before answering any question. A calculated answer in court is accepted just as fine as something off the cuff. There is nothing dishonest about taking your time to answer a question in any setting and in my opinion its a refined behavior. Im not saying she is very smart or refined, but there is nothing wrong with giving a calculated answer if and when one chooses to. TLDR. The disparity between answering an easy question with her mouth open, or taking the time to finish chewing for a more complex question is not a testament to her dishonesty.

comment: The narrator comments that now she's not comfortable with talking with her mouth full, but she did it earlier.  I would counter that the initial food was a single berry (?), and this was a significantly larger amount. That doesn't change the fact that she uses stalling tactics throughout. comment:
Johnny's "smirk", imo, is just a habit. When you're known as a funny person, or when you've had to smile at cameras and in interviews, or especially when you've had to force yourself to smile and pretend everything is okay for so long... it just happens. People who have been through traumatic events, especially prolonged abuse (of any kind), when recalling them/having to retell them it's not all sobs and crying. Very often it's with a forced smile that we don't even realize we're using. It's just such an ingrained thing to keep your happy face on that you can't stop it. That's what I see in Johnny's half "smiles".

Amber's on the other hand... there's nothing even slightly victim-like in her behavior and I hope she rots.

author: Mod Doll

comment:
As a survivor of domestic violence, and have also done advocacy for abused women AND men. Im not buying what she's selling. And JUST to be clear,  IM NO SUPER FAN of Johnny Depp or Amber Heard. 

The way Depp recollects he seems to be more believable as tiny details aren't remembered by victims. Its major things and the result. So I'm going to say my vote is for Depp being the true "victim" . Hopefully, thev truth comes out. If it is found  she was the abuser, I hope something is done about it. As too many times women lie (men do lie as well but not as often) but those who lie make it very difficult for true victims.  Not only are they wasting time and valuable resources by lying, but when a true victim shows up that victim can feel as if they are being victimized again due to the line of questioning and scrutiny they have to endure. 

And before anyone goes crazy on me for NOT taking Amber Heards side.  With  stuff like "how do you know how she would  react" why should she act like a "victim" stuff like that.  I am a SURVIVOR  domestic violence.  I was once a victim. when I was questioned and when ba have sat by the side of many victims being questioned,  the ONLY time they will hesitate to answer a question  its due to FEAR that nothing will be done to their abuser. So they FEAR that their abuser hears about what they said. That that victim will end up getting more severely beat up or possibly killed. Or even worse in a victims eyes, that their abuser decides that whatever or whoever in the victims family or friend group the abuser has threatened harm to. That victim FEARS  their abuser will finally act on that threat. 

Hopefully this doesn't drag out in court however. As when that happens it is very difficult for the victim. Abusers find control and power by using the courts and lawyers to continue to abuse their victim.

comment:
i think amber heard is an estp (mbti). so she will be very easily bored. she also won't live in emotions, she will repress them. the way i see it and i am an entp myself, we kinda have two modes: angry and happy / careless. we never get really sad or nostalgic or whatever. whenever a negative feeling manifest in me it turns into anger. like this: you sonnuva! how dare you mistreat that animal! i'm never like this: awww, poor animal etc. the latter helps nobody. i would rather punish the abuser than to empathize with the tortured thing.  

so that' why amber heard has that kind of body language. you don't even have to believe jungian personality types specifically. you can just think this way: she is not a feeler (except anger). don't you believe there are people like that? people who run away from negative feelings? exhaust those negative feelings via anger? 

now you might say this: that's exactly the kind of person who would go to violence. maybe. but maybe not. she seemed pretty convincing to me with the baby sister part. she just do not play the stereotypical victim role you want to see?

author: Ling Lai

comment:
A reason why many might consider body language analysis pseudoscience is because of the concrete fact that (at this moment) one person does not have direct access to another persons qualia, or in other words, you can't know what they're thinking.

This is where it starts to get philosophical and a lot of people lose interest. Hold on for just one second for me and try to finish this comment out (:

When one person doesn't have DIRECT access to another persons mental state/qualia/experience, this doesn't mean you can't have some sense of access to those states to produce some hypothesis about what their behavior and body language are MEANING. 

Just like the English language, body language can also have meaning. We don't sit here and argue about whether or not one can really know what someone is thinking from what they're saying. WE ALL DO THAT ANYWAY! Even if Amber directly looked at the camera and said outright that she was lying, and all of this story between their marriage was fabricated on her part, this argument would stand against her claims. How can we really know that's what she's thinking?

Spoiler alert! We can't :) We can make educated guesses on what happened based on all the evidence we have, up to and including Amber Heard's body language. Thanks for reading!

comment: Police should have done informant questioning method on her. FBI uses that to figure out if someone is telling the truth or not (on supposed informants). How do they do it? First time asking entire story from start to finish. Second time they ask the ending of the story. Third time they mix up ending and beginning and the last time, they ask random questions about beginning, ending, middle part and come up with "small" lies as if they forgot, to make sure if the person says the right thing. I am sure Amber would have told 5 times the different story because majority of liars aren't able to keep their story correct. If someone is the REAL victim of the abuse, every tiny word and action gets stuck to their head due strong emotion. Brain remembers extreme shocks very well. Even rape victims can say the story the same 20 years later as if it happened yesterday. I am sure if they asked that from her, she would have gotten caught pretty quickly. Imagine if the lawyer did this in court. She would be busted SOOO quickly.

comment: Some say "duper's delight," but really this looks more like a "wince of pain" that happens with PTSD sufferers. Watching combat vets recount combat actions can give you the same response. comment: With Johnny's Depp tendency to laugh to himself and make jokes about his injuries, you have to understand how some people cope with depression and a traumatic background. Thinking of things humorously is a defense often seen in those with severe depression. A fine example is Jim Carey and Robin Williams. This can be seen in Johnny Depp in other videos where he is saying something potentially serious like "I'm scared, I'm confused, I want to go home", but he laughs about it. It's seen in this video where he's making light of his serious injury by calling his finger "little Richard". From what I've heard, Johnny Depp's mother was abusive and he most likely endured a lot of trauma. As a way to not be completely overwhelmed, some trauma victims will make jokes about their experience or do things like thing of the irony of the situation in order to regulate their emotions.

comment:
People who are traumatized often have difficulty articulating their own narrative. The connection between the memory and the speech centers in the brain short circuit. That‚Äôs why talk therapy is so important because one loses the inability and the trauma becomes frozen and internalized. 

Anyhow, that‚Äôs what Johnny reminds me of ‚Äî someone struggling to spit it out. It‚Äôs hard because you start to re-trigger yourself. So then you try to calm yourself and tell yourself it‚Äôs okay (like when he grins) so you don‚Äôt go into a dissociative episode.

comment: As victim of DV, this just hurts. It's people like her that make it so hard for victims to get justice. Im choking up just typing this. Watching her talk and body language reminds me of my abuser. I don't understand why a "victim" would behave in the way she did. When I recall and describe moments of abuse its so hard to keep it together. I'm constantly scared that I won't ever be believed because my abuser has and will always do everything he can to discredit me. It's so draining. My case is in the works and i pray that my baby and I will be ok. Honestly, sometimes... It's so hard to keep trucking but my friends, family, and counsilor give me so much hope and strength to stand up against my abuser. There are so many times where I feel I want to give up because I am so Unbelievably and unimaginably tired. But as soon as I feel a bit of that thought enter my head, I know for darn sure I will not go down that easily. it's tough as hell but I will continue to be the tough ground my daughter stands on ..  I have my baby, my daughter who is the love of my life to protect. I do it all for her and myself. I will never give up. Stay strong out there to all my muggles in a struggle. Y'all are badass! Lots of love, hugs and good vibes your way.

comment:
I think this was a very toxic relationship and both people did things they may not be proud of, however to me I think it's pretty clear that Amber is lying her ass off. She's acting,  and she's not very good at it.  I've listened to audio previous to this,  and there are many times that Amber admits to being physical with him, and she twists things  that she says,  or that he says,  when clearly he's trying to rationalize with an irrational  person. 

I've been in toxic relationships,  I understand that there is a really screwed up dynamic when looking back at things,  but I never allowed anything to go so far as to physically hurt myself or my partner.  Emotionally,  yes,  all over the place.  Totally unhealthy.  In fact, sometimes during our worst fights we  actually became flirty with each other,  and started laughing or getting sexual. Again, it's not a healthy relationship, and while it's certainly an emotional  mind fuck, my relationship  was never physically  abusive.  (At least the one I'm referring to presently)
So I can understand that really fucked up dynamic, especially  when trying to recall things.  
Again, clearly a toxic relationship here,  but from everything I've heard and seen, I believe that Amber was definitely the physical  abuser here.

comment: If I may ask a question or 2 Sir (I don‚Äôt remember if you said your name in the video, haven‚Äôt seen your videos before) but are you ALSO a therapist that specializes in domestic violence?? Because if not, you don‚Äôt know what to look for in how somewhat acts or what mannerisms they use to express what they feel. I‚Äôll use myself as an example. I had to pull my teacher aside after parenting class and explain to her about my panic disorder. I was afraid she would notice my excessive fidgeting and taking notes and see it as being irritated, uninterested in being there, and or rude. I let her know, if I need a few minutes to collect myself and cannot in that moment speak to or express how I‚Äôm feeling in front of everyone, that I may silently excuse myself and I‚Äôm not trying to be disrespectful. When I am nervous or a certain situation hurts my heart, I fidget, I look around the room, I try my coping mechanisms, singing a soothing song in my head, taking notes actually helps me keep my attention not on the anxiety. I had to go to court many times and experienced severe anxiety and panic attacks a lot. Court can be very traumatic especially if they are labeling you as an abuser. I remember sitting in court next to my Mom waiting my turn and braiding my hair. Trying to keep my mind focused on anything, but the anxiety. Sometimes I couldn‚Äôt breathe, I had a full on melt down before I could even get to the court room and had to sit on the floor with my head between my knees, begging to leave. If it wasn‚Äôt for God and my Mother and Church family, I NEVER would have gotten through it. It‚Äôs not something I talk about as it retraumatizes me. But I just want to make sure that you‚Äôre really taking into account both of them and their mental health. I have selective mutism and don‚Äôt always speak to my fianc√©‚Äôs family, they usually speak to me first. The whole time I‚Äôm afraid they think I‚Äôm rude. Which is kinda what his parents thought originally, unfortunately. They treat me a lot kinder now that we are engaged. They just really hated us living together without being married. When I was with my abuser, there were times he was always so cool calm and collected. I had to face him in court, and I was excited but nervous. I wanted justice for myself, but I was so scared they‚Äôd believe his charming act. Surprisingly he seemed very standoffish and angry, arrogant and cocky. I for whatever reason thought he‚Äôd handle things a lot more collectedly. My lawyer was unbelievably kind. They let him get bailed out knowing he was a flight risk and he‚Äôs been on the run all this time. Years. I remember things in bits and pieces. I worry that since I can‚Äôt remember things in chronological order, I‚Äôll forget something super important and if I bring it up later, I‚Äôll be looked at as a liar. So I write things down in order as specifically as I can. I want to write a book, I want to help other women (and some men) but I also don‚Äôt want to retraumatize myself. I‚Äôm in a safe committed relationship now. From suicidal and stuck in an abusive relationship with a horrible man and his wretched family, to a kind, God loving man, who always holds me and speaks words of wisdom and encouragement to me. And his family has excepted me as one of their own finally and his sisters aren‚Äôt mean, they are exceptionally kind, inclusive and talented. I‚Äôm so blessed. But there are still people crying stuck in a dark place like I was and I want to help them find the light like I did. It is possible to find happiness, to find peace. If you have Stockholm Syndrome, it is possible to break those binds. It is possible to love someone who is good to you, and it is possible to find someone who truly loves you. And you deserve love. I don‚Äôt care who you are, what you‚Äôve done or what you‚Äôve said. You deserve love. I‚Äôm sorry for rambling. But I just want to make sure you‚Äôre being careful in case Amber is not the one who is the abuser, because you could re-traumatize her. No offense at all to Johnny but isn‚Äôt he a depressed alcoholic?? That could be why he looks at the ground and stumbles over his words a lot. Definitely not saying either of them are the abuser, I‚Äôm just saying it could go a lot deeper than this. Technically they could both be abusers. And ain‚Äôt no one stupid enough to be sending your ass money.

comment:
Look at 25:00-ish - isn't it obvious that JD isn't sober, but she is? He looks down at his petite Japanese fans, but also: he is kind of unstable in his moves. She obviously looks to distance herself from him, like with one part of her telling that she is there for her husband and with the other part telling that she is sober and doesn't approve of his not being at his best, and is a little ashamed of him, not just a little bit haughty. He is aware of this distancing and kind of pleads for more solidarity, her giving a greater show of affection ("me and my girl have been talking") - but despite of him talking with non-native English speakers, he speaks very unclearly, in a situation when one expects anybody to do their best to speak with very distinct pronunciation for better understanding. He speaks like one who is used to be drunk and pretend he isn't.
I don't know what to make out of their relationship. "Not healthy" is of course the least one can say. Why would a young girl marry a man who could be her father? Why would a mature man marry a little girl who could be his daughter? Where's the sanity in that? What miracles have they expected the other to perform for them, what curious needs to be fulfilled? What illusions have been crushed, causing deep hurt, envy, jealousy, hurt, enraged need of revenge? 
Perhaps they both started with an immense need to be adored and admired? And it turned out none of them could get enough to quench that craving.
I feel sorry for them - both need lots and lots of therapy and help.

comment: As someone who has been through traumatic things and abuse I can say that the more details you remember about a traumatic event, the more you are probably lying. When something traumatic happens you usually forget quite a bit except for the main things that you saw as being traumatic. Even the traumatic things themselves can be forgotten because you are trying to repress the memory. You wouldn‚Äôt remember the color of the wallpaper or the type of flooring in the room you‚Äôre in when you‚Äôre being hit. All you most likely will remember is who was abusing you, and what position you were in when they were abusing you.

comment: On Johnny's half-smile...I do the exact same thing whenever I speak about something that's potentially emotionally distressing for someone to have to hear or when I have to speak about something that's personally distressing for me to have to talk about. It's very much a subconscious self-soothing tick I have found is more of a common thing with highly empathic people (supposedly linked to the mimic smiling reflex). He only does it when recalling the incidents he says he suffered, just as he is about to speak. Definitely not 'Duper's Delight'. Anyway, that's just my opinion from my own experience.

comment: 21:17 Hi ho, this is only through my experience and what I infer, but that hesitation and the smiles and nervous laughs and such are commonly used when we're trying to tell our story after not being able to for so long. We hesitate because our brains are constantly in fight or flight mode and it could have been that he hesitated expecting something bad to come out of speaking out because that usually happens, there's nothing but danger everywhere if we so much as give the wrong facial expression and that mentality can take from days to years to break out of. Nervous laughs and such are our way of covering up how terrified we really are because THEY are either in the room or on our minds. Again, this is just how I saw it and you can totally disagree since everyone is different in responses to that. In conclusion, it's mostly forcing on a mask because that's the norm for us in every stressful situation, this one is no different, and considering the people, it involves it's to be expected because it's around those people that we formed habits because of and/or for. Guys, I promise it'll get better. I'm living proof. God bless you guys and please, please stay safe

Remark: yes, it is contradictory that she nods her head and says no. Yet she shows she understands the question (nod) and her answer is 'no' (she could be either prepared or swift in communication). There seem to be a lot of open questions for the analyst. Please consider or read about the Stanford Prison Experiment or systemic approaches. 'Prove her innocence? ' is it either victim or villain or could it be both? Or neither?. 
She shows disinterest (and yes, I would regard this as disrespectful), and she looks annoyed (sideways look), yet I would still believe her words. It seems he crossed a border (maybe without awareness) and she tried to keep him at a distance. The 'hit' looks like a misunderstanding or accident to me. I bet it hurt. I hope courts will someday find a less stressful design for reconciliation.

author: Rafe 8

comment: I don't handle trauma like you would "expect". People assume you're gonna be crying, sad, etc. For me I think when I'm speaking of something negative that has happened to me, I often try to mask my true feelings and keep my composure, or I try to lighten the general mood because of how uncomfortable I am, or how uncomfortable the person I'm speaking to may be, and often it's an involuntary action, but I will chuckle or smirk or make a joke. So I understand why Johnny keeps doing that. People who have never been in that situation don't understand and will confuse this for joy or amusement but it's really more of a defense mechanism.
author: Yana Nikolaychuk

author: Whippy99

comment:
I think the smirk from JD is what I usually do. When something makes me uncomfortable or a bad memory and instead of showing a more appropriate facial gesture I would smirk or smile because it comforts me a little. Like life isn't fair so smile and things will be a little better. It isnt an ideal response but I can't fully control it. I also smirk or smile when I recall an uncomfortable situation I know I do that to also comfort myself because when I recall it the situation already happened. When you survive a bad childhood you tend to learn certain coping mechanisms that help you deal with the obserdity of the world. The injustice and unfairness of how things plays out. You try to focus on the light of things so you can move forward instead of feeling the bad parts of things. And sometimes I smirk when I see how ironic the whole situation was... I helped someone but that person ended up hurting me... Then I recall how dumb I was allowing that person into my life and recalling red flags I ignored.
I don't know how many people do that but in psychology it is a neural coping mechanism

comment:
I‚Äôm on Johnny‚Äôs side not because who he is but because of the evidence infront of me . BIGGEST indicator to me that she‚Äôs lying is the eating / snacking while telling someone of the traumatizing abuse you went through but let‚Äôs move on .
So I‚Äôll say this abuse victims SPECIFICALLY WOMEN who are abused or talking about their abuse & have not yet gotten to that stage where they‚Äôve overcame it or have become stronger usually always look the same :
Hunched over or closed into themselves 
Crying or tearful the entire recount of what happened 
Quiet unless spoken to
Timid 
Keep their head down or avoid looking around
Jumpy 
Arms folded or holding hands together

this is just a general observation now I am aware everyone processes things differently & don‚Äôt have the same reactions BUT this is generally the reaction for female abuse victims . 
Amber seems to be none of these things in fact her entire demeanor gives of the vibe of ‚Äú ok I did it and ‚Äú she‚Äôs bored looks totally uninterested about what‚Äôs going but the reality is she‚Äôs supposed to be recounting her terrible abuse story yet all she seems to care about is stuffing her face . In between questions she‚Äôs bored / uninterested When asked about what she did to Johnny slight annoyance peeks through then throws out her ‚Äú fear ‚Äú then proceeds to flip it over to Johnny being the abuser & her fake crying then the stutters while trying to speak about what he did .

comment:
@Observe ...Interessting. I'd like to say: as a person who has been abused myself, i understand the little smiley thing jhonny does when he tells his story. It is difficult to explain in few words...but it goes along the lines of:  remembering a situation like that and considering having stayed in an abusive relationship you had to always find some way, some reason to stay. So you keep telling yourself that it wasn't that bad and you might even ridicule the situation. Somehow you might even not believe it yourself that you at all stayed with that person allthough these bad things happened. If you fully admit it to yourself you might lose your mind. And keeping these things 'funny' in your mind is what actually helped you to survive it all. I found myself many times sort of laughing while telling my therapist about one or the other thing and actually only realized through the seriousnes of my oposit how bad it actually was what happened. Thing is, when you grow up being abused your mind choses ways to survive these situations. Unfortunately we tend to re-live over and over what we grew up with, unless we chose to change ourselfs which involves longterm work with your inner children and more. But it is possible! :)

Now that Amber lady...she's a sociopath. Or maybe not. I don't care. But i don't like her. Can't trust her at all.

comment: I am a firm believer that body language can be use as a real psychology tool if the mainstream psychology/social science giant heads get over themselves. I haven't checked but if the DMS-V doesnt carry a section on body language they have just taken away 60% or most of a psychologist accuracy in a diagnosis. Even FBI profilers use body language to determine someone's honesty. So how can we get this to be taken more seriously. Look at candid photos of any couple if their head lean together they are likely happy with each other. Look at siblings in a photo you know who dislike who. This isn't rocket science.

Fortunately he met my stepmom who is the most wonderful woman on this planet who takes amazing care of him and my sister. comment:
I'm not defending her or anything here, just sayingüòÜ:

At the part where she nods her head then said no, actually I do that a lot too when I'm not paying attention/bored at someone who asked me then they'll followed up with asking if I know/understand what they said after I didn't respond immediately, I'll nod as a way of saying yes I know/understand what you said then say no/yes as a respond to the main question. Of course they'll get confused at me if my answer to the main question is no after nodding, they'll think I'm answering the question: do you know/understand what I said? And if I changed my answer, they'll think I'm guilty/lying or something. So my main point is, maybe, just MAYBE we're the same, answering the two questions consecutively.

With that I rest my case...üòÜ

author: Stephanie Addy

comment:
All I have to add is all you need to look out for is her forehead and her mouth. She is desperately trying to conceal her contempt and feeling of superiority over the people in the room and over Johny. Her mouth at a few times is about to stretch enough only to the one side,  it's sort of a half-smile that is the classic tell tell sign for contempt. She keeps trying to suppress that throughout the conversation and appear sullen and sad. The frantic eyes twitching and looking around, the hand supporting her head all are ways to dissipate her energy from feeling  arrogance and not being able to show it since she has to pretend she's a victim. Notice how she almost smiles at a few times like she thinks she got them like "her lie is winning over" this is what you expect to see from frequent liars being happy to be able to get away with it. Also the biggest tell is the forehead. No action there whatsoever. If you look at real victims of abuse or people feeling sadness or pain you'd see that thing wrinkle and twirl and the eyebrows getting close together - her - recalling what's supposed to be a beating - no action. I can say her anger is real about protecting her sister but then again we'd have to remember that is a situation she came up with and in an imaginary situation you can  imagine reacting to it and the reaction will be real even though the situation maybe made up. Unless there is prove that the thing with the stairs happened I doubt there is truth to it.

Overall, I think they are both a little immature, Depp is probably blind to people being manipulative at all. He seems so naive towards this.  If there weren't those millions that they both have we'd never hear of this since their divorce is like children splitting up they both seem more frustrated and trying to make the other look bad rather than actually being abusive towards one another.

I'd say she probably even married him for the money after the initial thrill of dating Johny Depp was over...

comment: Thank you for this video. I've watched quite a few on this particular case, and what it really brings home to me is just how often we are facing lies that are presented as truth. Many of us end up being so confused, in real life, about what's true and what isn't - who has witnessed complete mess-ups within their own family, while everyone pretended that everything was allright? etc - that in the end, the way we function in society is a big reflection of this pattern as well. Politics are the best example, where lies areblatent, yet somehow we agree to pretend they're not lies. This case , as is always the case... is a perfect example of how a microcosm mirrors the macrocosm. As within, so without. Awesome. Maybe someone will get it and look deeper ; )

comment: Psychology is a seudoscience  bc it is based off of peoples experiences. Enough of the experiences align to produce a phenomenon. These phenomenon are then called disorders. These disorders are treated with varies different medications and treatments. Its rational to think that most people who exhibit phenomenons at this ooint are most likely bot being truthful and have in fact thought they had a certain phenomenon and now present woth indicators to a disorder. The point is...most people have to merely say they have a disorder and have never really had a disorder. Once a professional diagnosis the disorder the chances a person is going to actually develoo the disorder in time are high even though they had never reslly had a disorder they are exhibiting known markers bc they want to confirm that the way they feel is out of their control. It doesnt mean that these disorders do t exist, just at a much smaller rate. Almost all others are phenomenon exhibited from a persons varies experiences or lack thereof. So I would say Psychology is a seudo science  in every sense of the statement. In fact your analysis is probably light years ahead of psychology even if you are correct 70% of the time. Double blind would work wonders if ingrained bias didnt exist.

author: Irene Rojas

comment:
Observing body language is an important part of communication and, as you stated, it isn't necessarily foolproof.  I really like that you are showing people how to do that.


Edit:  It's also interesting that when asked other questions, she looks around a lot and demonstrates reluctance to answer directly yet when she was asked who was on the audio recording, she gave direct eye contact and her following responses seemed rehearsed- note she looks left following her explanations of the event being asked about.  This is a good indication of deception in her body language.  It's the discomfort she exhibits is _somewhat_ commensurate with behavior of domestic violence survivors and sexual assault survivors.  In the latter instance, there is almost always a sense of shame combined with dread in the survivor's responses and body language.  She doesn't really exhibit those things plausibly.  Further, she seems to find the proceeding boring and just prior to her resting her face on her hand, her eye contact bordered on hostile.  At this point, for me, she's lost all credibility.  So did the lawyer by asserting that she could answer a yes or no question however she wanted.  That's a tactic used by lawyers to assuage guilt and deflect the question altogether.  Similarly, demands for yes or no questions aren't always followed by a demand for explanation and are often used to box someone in.  

Johnny exhibits the same kind of behavior survivors do when trying to recall something very painful or frightening to recall.  

I also completely agree with your conclusion regarding the dynamic of their relationship as demonstrated in the final clip.  

Thank you!

comment:
Concerning the food thing: I see that behaviour a bit differently. I don't see a link to not-caring, I know this behaviour from business meetings. It's a way of compensating insecurity. Whenever there are snacks on the big meeting table, unsecure participants start reaching over to it to actually DO something to hide their unsecurity. The more uncomfortable they feel the more they stuff your mouth. I even did that myself.
You can observe that when the question regarding hitting Johnny Depp with her fist comes. "Isn't it true, that..." implies a tough question and she goes grabbing some more.

comment:
14:36 Her response that she said whatever was on the recording was the correct thing to say in that situation. It would be the correct thing to say if the same question was put to Johnny as well. Because there is a recording, lawyers from either side could try tripping them up by seeking confirmation for something being said that wasn't actually recorded. 
She literally used the same answer her lawyer had provided, but you immediately attributed it to her "not listening". What was it about her body language that indicated she wasn't listening? You only commented on her verbal response to the question...18:38 Your analysis is that you're frustrated and the same question being asked 3 times is not good news for Amber? She was doing as her lawyer instructed, as most people would in that situation. 
I understand that you've already watched the depositions before recording this video, and maybe that has influenced your presentation, but this is the first time I've felt like you have a bias against the person you're analyzing.

Regardless of Body language or any other subjective tells - the fact remains is that Johnny Depp chose the easiest place in the World to sue, the UK laws mean that the burden of proof was not on Johnny Depps lawyers but the opposition.  And he lost!

Obviously the UK courts get it wrong every now and again - but Body language vs the UK courts lol no contest mate.

comment:
Your baseline is sooo far off with her..  ;/.  She looks around because of ADHD and her mindset of moving items and objects and light changes.  Which is what she does all the time in other interviews as well.   So to base most of the baseline off that concept just throws too many flaws into the other subjective contexts further down the reading..........  But what do I know.  I do this in real time scenarios in war zones.  Forensic behavioralism to the point of assessing legal aspects is too corrupt for me to get into.  Truth will never set you free, when there are others claiming truth is opposite of what it is.

The whole concept of eyes darting around, as showing lack of interest.  It's true in her mentality at the moment, due to her ADHD and public life circumstances.  It's her mind being over loaded with ocular events that she is trying to buffer out.  ADHD.  The misalignment is caused by the ADHD and indication of any guilt or concept of guilt.  Not saying the domestic issues weren't a problem.  But the cues going on this video are misconstrued.

Where you point out how Johnny kinda smirks at the beginning of his recollection i think its important to note that some people that have experienced a lot of trauma have developed a coping mechanism of making the trauma funny or trying to diffuse an abuser with humor so its totally possible that that reaction upon thinking about this horrible situation was this type of coping mechanism playing out. Like when he recalls the actual trauma he also recalls the way he made it funny and/or was trying to make it comfortable for everyone else.  

Its also kinda obvious to me that amber could very well be a psychopath or sociopath that doesn't feel emotions or doesn't feel them appropriately which is made evident by her inability to even fake any kind of emotion she thinks she should have because she has never really had them. comment:
Dep is notoriously shy. A lot of performers are. He also comes from a punk rock, and music background. Again just my two cents, there is a Gallos humor that's part and parcel to that scene. Regarding his smirk, notice it comes up right before he describes her throwing a vodka bottle. Just my opinion but I read that, as him acknowledging the absurdity of that act. Little Amber heard throwing a big vodka bottle at him is an absurd image, I I myself was in an abusive relationship with a small woman, and I'm a big bald man. It never got physical. But there were occasions, because of her inability to value me as a human being, where she literally put my life in jeopardy. My existential being was threatened due to her negligence because she did not value me as a human being. I won't go into the details, needless to say when I have told the story, I laugh. Because it is both terrifying, tragic and absurd. 
Just a thought. Really enjoying this I just stumbled across your channel, you have a new fan. I have been "reading "people since I was a kid. Mostly a survival skill LOL. But then over the years I became conscious of it and started working with it. This shit is like catnip for my brain LOL thank you

comment:
I've actually watched a few of Johnny's interviews with Ellen and other people like that and noticed that when he talks about something he's upset about or particularly doesn't like he does the half smirk to kind of make the other person think he's joking to clear the tension, kind of like when he made a joke about naming his cut finger. He also fiddles with his rings and looks down at his hands which to me seems like an anxiety tick to help self soothe himself. His uncomfortable body language is so obvious if you watch other interviews and you learn to pick up his subtle movements. He was able to answer the question that was being asked with only the necessary details and got to the point. 
Ambers movements make her seem like she's trying way to hard to get others to believe her and you can tell she's not fully convinced with what she's saying, she couldn't even answer a yes or no question without telling this huge elaborate story that had nothing to do with the question being asked. Eating in a court room situation is extremely rude and I doubt if you were being asked questions about your abuser that you would be eating because if that was me I would not even have an apatite. Her lawyer also seemed very unprofessional and rude to the questioner and made a big deal over something so small to buy her more time to answer the question.  Also how is it she can fully remember the tiniest of details of her surroundings during a situation but all of a sudden she "doesn't remember" if she hit him or not. I think if someone was truly being abused they wouldn't just forget a situation like this.

comment: I know when I have to talk about past traumas that I find myself throwing in some humor or dark humor. In my mind I can either live in the fear always, especially when I have to talk about it, or I can shield myself from the trauma that has happened and not re-live it and find some kind of silver lining in it. In one instance someone was shooting right outside my bedroom window, I was shit scared and it was traumatizing, but I can't help laughing at my reaction. I rolled out of bed, crawled in to the livingroom and called the police. Now when I tell someone about that experience I always tell it like I was in an action movie. I think that "little Richard" is just a coping mechanism to him, or he tries to downplay it with humor as his shield. I don't know if I'm right, but I don't think Depp is lying in this messy messy case.

comment:
Justice for Johnny! I've been a victim to women like Amber myself. Hitting me and then trivialize on the act, saying that "It wasnt THAT hard" and "You're such a pussy" etc. Hitting another person isnt allways about physical damage but also mental. Its very hurtfull to beeing struck by someone close to you, who you care for (Or thought you cared for). And this happens too much towards men, cause women just think its okey cause we're men and we should be able to take it, no problem.

However, EVERY action men does towards women, is too often blown out of proportion. Im not saying however physically, verbally or mentally abuse of women (or men) is by any means OK. But it is happening too often in the modern "Fuck the patriarchy" days that men are painted in a picture that does not represent a truthfull reality because of certain modern movements. I think its time this is balanced out to an equal level. Abuse is NOT okey towards women OR men.

I'm not saying Johnny Depp is 100% Innocent, he very well may NOT be. But its clear and obvious that amber is no saint either, and the public treatment is harsh on depp whilst amber is painted as an innocent victim by the press, media and public. Its not okey.

comment:
I googled your name Logan and saw that your earlier ventures into "filmmaking" were a bit of a flop, I mean, your film, "August" (on your namesake's channel -> Logan Portenier) is nothing more than a brag about your equipment, and below average at that. It's no wonder it flopped. So I'm guessing you did a three week internet course to become a "Body Language Analyst" to cash in on the REACT craze, made even more "substantial" with your "Analyst" title. 

Personally, I find it offensive to see that you are exploiting this new market of "Let's all hate on personalities' crimes and misdemeanors". And I find it strange that in your "Analyst" studies, they didn't teach you about voice evidence. Surely it would constitute a decent chunk of the curriculum, Logan. Why don't you explain exactly what your qualifications are because I don't think a genuine analyst would so cartoonishly mimic or parody someone whether they are guilty or not, as you did Amber about that whispering part. Red flag. 

For the record, I think Amber Heard is a total narcissist and my "YouTuber Analyst" skills tell me you are a con-artist. Stop abusing this resource for monetary gain if you are not a true analyst. Oh, and I also noted the "Mentalism" videos you have. LOL. Aren't you lucky people are so dumb?

comment: It's extremely unfortunate because I do every single damn thing that she does, her body language, I mean. I suffer from depression, anxiety, ADHD, and as a result, I tend to do all of those quick movements, shrugging, eye rolling etc as a result of my insecurities. I always thought that what I was doing was a reflection of my discomfort and inner struggles, however,  I've always had issues everywhere I go. School, workplace, etc. It's always been the same thing. My "attitude". I'm the nicest, kindest, most loyal person, and people that truly know me can vouch for that.. But my demeanor gives everyone an impression that I have a "diva" attitude, I come across as rude and insufferable, and have struggled with this ever since i was a kid. Worst thing is, I wasn't even aware of my movements up until a few months ago, but all along, my depression got worse mostly because of how horribly people treated me, trying to "put me where I belong" when I was always nice to them as much as I was aware of. My facial expressions, resting bitch face, everything has fetched me so much problems and even in cases where others were framing me for things I didn't do, the others got away with it because my "attitude" aligned with their accusations against me. If Amber is anything like me, god save her.

author: Ciara Goering

comment: I talk from experience on myself when i was younger and had little knowledge and conciousness about my mental state: a lot of what is referred as "lack of concern" and "disrespect", things such as half-closed eyelids, looking around frantically, eating or doing anything else that does not concern the situation she is currently in... these things appear to me as defense mechanisms, ways to take distance from the situation she feels as very uncomfortable or dangerous. it's basically the same as plugging your ears and talking loudly to avoid hearing something you really don't want to hear, same instinct. Before watching or hearing evidence such as this deposition or phone calls, i thought "she might be some cold opportunist"... now what i think is that she might be really struggling with her mental health, which has interfered with her actions during who knows how many years from now. Ultimately she is still to be held accountable for all of her actions and words, but i strongly suspect that there is a substantial percentage of all which is "unintentional" and driven by her issues, basically i think she is not a victim of his ex-husband, but partially a victim of herself. She made a huge, huge mess, but not to such a degree where she is not deserving any empathy or comprehension.

comment: I think it's important when dealing with an abusive relationship between two people, there's usually some truth behind both sides, one thing people don't usually consider is that it is absolutely entirely possible that BOTH people are abusive to each other one may abuse differently than the other one however it's still abuse. Another thing people don't consider much is abuse isn't just physical, it can be emotional, physical, psychological abuse.  Also, speaking from my own experience, Alcoholics can present differently sober as they do drunk, and they also can be completely oblivious to their actions they carry out while drunk.  So they absolutely will believe whole heatedly they didn't do anything because they don't recall it. I think Amber is full of shit for the most part, but I don't think Johnny is completely innocent either.

comment:
My first impressions from observing Amber‚Äôs nonverbal behaviors: 1. Her facial and upper body movements so resemble those of Hilary Clinton. 2. One of Amber‚Äôs big tells is revealed in how she holds her head, jaw, neck AND shoulders+posture.

As for Johnny: my impression of the ‚Äúsmirk‚Äù is something that shows in the face when feeling sarcastic, recalling a scene from memory perceived by the storyteller to be ridiculous, or feeling embarrassed/regret-maybe even a twinge of feeling caught of guard with sadness

As for an overall take on these two and their relationship. Most people are amazing when they present themselves as individuals. But what I have learned most from relationships is that one person‚Äôs amazing experience with anyone can be the next person‚Äôs nightmare. 

It all depends on the interactive elements and variables that occur between the couple. Some relationships like this one have a unique course of their own that generally seems to be meant for helping us learn to value and love ourself vs relying on someone else to do it for us.

comment: I've heard that before about extra details that aren't needed for the story as being lies. Also, if a story from more than one person matches exact details then it's likely false as well. comment:
Totally agree with your comments on both of their body language.
As a woman that was on the receiving end of many years of abuse, physical and mentally. I don't see her displays any emotion when recalling the attacks that she claims he inflicted on her. The stubbling on her words could be panic, but I don't feel like it is panic in the sense that she has been so mentally torn apart that her confidence is at an all time low and is unsure of how to word it.
J Depp, the forced little one side smile, I still do this now, it's a coping mechanism, almost like if I can smile about it then I'm OK, I'll joke about it because I don't want others to see my hurt and vulnerability, it's like my wall between my exposed nerves and them being able to touch on it. Some people missunderstand this and think it's a sign of dishonesty, which in a way it is because I'm covering my true feelings. I hope he finds peace in himself when this is all over, it takes a long time but I wish him all the best.
